name: Shana's Spaghetti Squash Muffins
author: starfroggie
summary: Too much spaghetti squash? Try this new recipe, which resembles other squash breads.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place spaghetti squash cut-side down in a shallow baking pan
Bake in the preheated oven until flesh is soft, about 1 hour 25 minutes
Scoop out flesh with a spoon and measure out 2 cups; refrigerate until cool, 15 to 20 minutes
Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, allspice, and salt together in a large bowl
Mix milk, eggs, butter, and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl
Fold the squash mixture into the flour mixture just until moistened
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin tins, filling each cup halfway
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes
Remove from muffin tins and cool on wire racks
